abstract: The French pharmaceuticals maker agreed to buy Primary Health Care, the biggest distributor of vitamin supplements in Australia, for 560 million Australian dollars ($546 million).
snippet: The French pharmaceuticals maker agreed to buy Primary Health Care, the biggest distributor of vitamin supplements in Australia, for 560 million Australian dollars ($546 million).
lead_paragraph: Sanofi-Aventis, the French pharmaceuticals maker, agreed to buy Primary Health Care, the biggest distributor of vitamin supplements in Australia, for 560 million Australian dollars ($546 million). Sanofi, based in Paris, is seeking new sources of revenue before the Plavix and Lovenox anticlot treatments compete with cheaper copies, starting in 2011. Primary Health Care, based in Sydney, will use the funds to reduce debt tied to its takeover of Symbion Health in February and is part of a plan to sell consumer and pharmacy units acquired in that deal.

headline.main: Australia: Sanofi-Aventis Buys Vitamin Supplement Distributor
headline.print_headline: AUSTRALIA: SANOFI-AVENTIS BUYS VITAMIN SUPPLEMENT DISTRIBUTOR
